intro: Hieracium chondrillifolium, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium chondrillifolium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
